newsitem.title: USA: Maine doubles cigarette tax for income tax relief.
newsitem.headline: Maine doubles cigarette tax for income tax relief.

text.p: Maine legislators late Friday approved doubling the state's cigarette tax to 74 cents per pack with the bulk of the revenue to be used for income tax relief.

The tax had support from lawmakers and Gov. Angus King as a way to reduce Maine's top-of-the-nation youth smoking rate, but the measure had been in limbo because of a fight over how to use the revenue it would produce.
King signed the measure within minutes of its final passage by the Senate.

Under a compromise with King, Democrats dropped a demand that the money be used to expand health insurance for low-income children. In return, King agreed to use $6.8 million from an estate tax settlement for the insurance program.
The tax increase is expected to raise $31 million in new revenue per year. Most will be used for income tax relief, but $3.5 million will fund new anti-smoking efforts aimed at children.
